Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product in the Runway Retail application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the product entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the product.

imageUrl.description: URL of the product's main image.

glbModelUrl.description: URL of the product's 3D model (GLB format).

styleGuideSuggestion.description: AI-powered style suggestion for the product.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a category of products (e.g., Casual, Streetwear).

id.description: Unique identifier for the category entity.

definition.description: Stores product information.  The `productId` is the document ID.

params.name: productId
params.description: The unique identifier for the product.

definition.description: Stores category information.  The `categoryId` is the document ID.

params.name: categoryId
params.description: The unique identifier for the category.

firestore.reasoning: The data structure prioritizes authorization independence and QAPs (Rules are not filters). Products are stored in a top-level `products` collection. Categories are also stored in a top-level `categories` collection. The `Category` document contains an array of product IDs. This structure avoids hierarchical `get()` calls in security rules.  The categories document `productIds` enables QAPs (listing products is secure, even when those categories have a large number of products).
